channel.title: Show Off Topic
channel.description:
Rsc wings [IMG]http://i274.photobucket.com/albums/jj267/uberpker/365.png[/img] And my client: [IMG]http://i274.photobucket.com/albums/jj267/uberpker/client.jpg[/img]
About the wings feel free to download if you want, would fit in a nice pk server. My self didn't know how to make it, its complicated. Feel free to Download it.

item.title: Show Off Topic
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Motaro, post:70, topic:259530”]Well that didn’t work, but this did:

while(owner.getInventory().contains(item)
{
owner.getInventory().remove(item)
}[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 13, 2009, 04:56:13 pm[/size][hr]OMG I’m winner! 

      							int b;
      							b = 0;
      			                 while(owner.getInventory().contains(item)) {
      			                    owner.getInventory().remove(item);
      			                    b++;
      			                 }       	 
      			                owner.getInventory().add(new InvItem(33, b));

Works flawlessly. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 13, 2009, 05:12:42 pm[/size][hr]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdPpqoJksjg[/quote]

Did you try doing what I suggested here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,344502.msg2659575.html#msg2659575 ?

That would be the best way to do it and would avoid wasted CPU cycles on pointless loops.

Imagine if you had over 9000 rune essencii (that’s the plural of rune essence!), the server would have to go through over 9000 loops.

Read full topic

item.title: Show Off Topic
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

Well that didn’t work, but this did:

while(owner.getInventory().contains(item)
{
owner.getInventory().remove(item)
}[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 13, 2009, 04:56:13 pm[/size][hr]OMG I’m winner! 

      							int b;
      							b = 0;
      			                 while(owner.getInventory().contains(item)) {
      			                    owner.getInventory().remove(item);
      			                    b++;
      			                 }       	 
      			                owner.getInventory().add(new InvItem(33, b));

Works flawlessly. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 13, 2009, 05:12:42 pm[/size][hr]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdPpqoJksjg

item.title: Show Off Topic
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

It’s not that. It’s because every unstackable apparently has an amount of one, no matter how many of the item you have. So no matter what, you can only remove one item at a time.

item.title: Show Off Topic
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

Added a rune essence mine.


I just gave up using unstackable essence!

So I made it that you have a 1/5 chance of mining an essence.

If anyone has any pointers on removing a certain amount of nonstackable items, let me know.

item.title: Show Off Topic
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

You really don’t know what your talking about, Player memory is not a problem at all, and probably holds less then 300kb each player in memory. Its the CPU processing more players to send/receive data to/from.

Also testing this, i do believe if you modify the client to send each packet, 700* over, and remove the packet delay on the server, and send packets from server > client 700* over, then you’d have a good chance of simulating 700 players using one.

Read full topic

Ok then it can easyly be calcauted from one player memory use per player on the connecter aka 1 Player = 3 Fake players can be easyly calcauated to the correct amount of players able to get used

Read full topic

item.title: Show Off Topic
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“Peter, post:53, topic:259530”][quote author=Peter link=topic=342732.msg2654349#msg2654349 date=1233757113]

[quote author=Lawls kk link=topic=342732.msg2654340#msg2654340 date=1233755682]

T_x that some ripped rs2 shit. Also to properly test, spamming logins will do nothing, it actually has to perform actions, send random amount of packets a human would etc to tell properly if a server can be stable.
[/quote]Its half of the one ive made on my rs2 crasher you can even go check that to…

+I do no its not the performace test of it but it can be easyly tested by making the server when they login do random shit like talking teleporting attacking a npc so on so on

That gives piss wrong results? You lose a shitload of speed on loading the user from the SQL database, you lose time/speed during data transfers etc. Just making your server perform a few K actions doesn’t even need a client end.
[/quote][/quote]

Well?

Read full topic
